missions.title: Missions
missions.noSelectedDescription: Choose a mission from the list.

winObjective.countBelow: Less than {count} out of {subjects} can survive.

restartDialog.message: Are you sure you want to abort the mission and restart it? The current progress will be lost.

quitDialog.message: Are you sure you want to abort the mission and quit? The mission will count as failed.

messages.tutorialWelcome: Welcome to the target practice tutorial!
messages.tutorialTargetIndicator:
Good job!
The next target is automatically selected. It is marked by a red reticle, or by an arrow if it is not visible in front of you. Its details are displayed in the top right corner of your HUD.
messages.tutorialMove: This container is farther away. Accelerate and decelarate ({controlStrings/keyboard/forward}/{controlStrings/keyboard/reverse}) to get closer to it. You can press {controlStrings/keyboard/resetSpeed} to come to a full stop. Destroy it when you are close enough!
messages.tutorialTargeting:
You can also switch targets manually.
({controlStrings/keyboard/nextNearestHostileTarget} / mouse: {controlStrings/mouse/nextNearestHostileTarget} / joystick: {controlStrings/joystick/nextNearestHostileTarget})
Destroy another container!
messages.tutorialImpactIndicators: The green crosshairs show the estimated positions where your projectiles will hit (or miss) your current target. There are always as many crosshairs as weapons on your ship. Fire when all your crosshairs are locked on your target.
messages.tutorialFixedWeapons: Note that unlike these training guns, some weapons cannot be rotated and always face strictly forward. You will need to aim more carefully with such weapons.
messages.tutorialMultiWeaponAiming: It is also not always possible to hit the enemy with all your weapons. You have to take your best chances.
messages.tutorialAimAssist: Notice the smaller red reticle near the center of your target. It shows its estimated position at the time your projectiles will reach it. You will need to aim at it to hit moving targets.
messages.tutorialMovingTargets: You can practice hitting moving targets by moving your own ship sideways while aiming. Make sharp turns at speed to drift, or strafe ({controlStrings/keyboard/strafeLeft}, {controlStrings/keyboard/strafeRight}, {controlStrings/keyboard/raise}, {controlStrings/keyboard/lower}) to achieve this.
messages.tutorialStrafingRolling:
Strafing ({controlStrings/keyboard/strafeLeft}, {controlStrings/keyboard/strafeRight}, {controlStrings/keyboard/raise}, {controlStrings/keyboard/lower}) is also very useful in combat for evading incoming projectiles.
Combining it with rolling ({controlStrings/keyboard/rollLeft}, {controlStrings/keyboard/rollRight}) makes you a very difficult target for enemies.
messages.tutorialViews1:
You can switch between different views. ({controlStrings/keyboard/nextView}/{controlStrings/keyboard/previousView})
Some make it easier to aim, while others are more useful for seeing incoming attacks.
messages.tutorialViews2:
In some views it is possible to look around holding down {controlStrings/keyboard/controlCamera} or using the extra axes on your joystick. You can also reset the view to its original state.
({controlStrings/keyboard/resetView} / joystick: {controlStrings/joystick/resetView})
messages.tutorialCruise1: We brought in some unarmed drones. Switch to cruise flight mode ({controlStrings/keyboard/toggleCruise}) to engage them. In this mode, you are allowed to move faster, but you are not allowed to strafe or drift. Your turn rate is restricted at high speed, thus your aim remains accurate.
messages.tutorialCruise2: Cruise flight mode is ideal for engaging or intercepting targets that are far away. Once you are close, switch back to combat mode ({controlStrings/keyboard/toggleCruise}) for better maneuverability.
messages.tutorialTargetingFriendly:
A friendly drone has arrived. If you wish, you can target non-hostile spacecrafts. ({controlStrings/keyboard/nextNearestNonHostileTarget} / mouse: {controlStrings/mouse/nextNearestNonHostileTarget})
Be careful though, as your rotating weapons will aim at the current target, even if it isn't hostile!
messages.tutorialControls: You can always check and modify the full set of controls in the control settings which you can reach from the menu. ({controlStrings/keyboard/quit})
messages.tutorialFinish: Destroy the rest of the drones to complete this mission! You can see the number of remaining enemies you need to destroy in the mission objective indicator on the left.

messages.rubyBladeArrived: Gamma 1: He's here! Ignore the guards! Quick, target the Ruby Blade, destroy it and let's get out of here!

messages.caution: Nice work taking out the bombers! Now stay clear of the Mississippi and let the frigates do their job.

messages.test:
This is a test mission. Fly around and do as you please.
This reminder will be displayed 5 times.
messages.test2: You can freely destroy other spacecrafts.

battle.developmentVersionNotice: Interstellar Armada: Galactic Ace - development version: {version}

message.ready:
Ready!
During the game, press the {menuKey} key to open the menu, where you can also check and adjust the controls.
message.victory:
All mission objectives have been completed!
Activate your jump engines ({controlStrings/keyboard/jumpOut}) to conclude the mission.
message.fail:
You have failed one of the mission objectives!
Activate your jump engines ({controlStrings/keyboard/jumpOut}) to conclude the mission.

defeat.message: You ship has been destroyed. What would you like to do?

jump.engaged:
JUMP ENGINES ENGAGED
Aligning velocity...

Press {controlStrings/keyboard/jumpOut} to cancel
jump.preparing:
JUMP ENGINES ENGAGED
Preparing...
{timeLeft}
Press {controlStrings/keyboard/jumpOut} to cancel

description.victory: You have earned {performance} medal for your performance in this mission.
description.nextPerformance: Achieve a performance score of {score} or more to earn a higher level distinction.
description.fail: You did not manage to complete all the objectives for this mission.
description.defeat: Your spacecraft has been destroyed during the mission.
description.leftEarly: You left the battlefield before completing all the mission objectives.

about.title: About
about.aboutGameParagraph: This game is a learning project in the early development phase. The current version is only intended for testing the initial, already implemented features of what one day might become a functional game. Even the core features are yet under development. The game might contain numerous bugs.
about.aboutAuthorLicenseParagraph:
This project is developed by Kriszti√°n Nagy, a BSc computer engineering graduate from Budapest University of Technology and Economics. The project is released under {license}, you can obtain the source code and the license from the project's {github} page.
The application features the {sansation} font family created by Bernd Montag, which is freeware, as well as the {aldrich} and {audiowide} fonts from the Google Fonts library, which are published under the {openFontLicense}. Some modifications to the former were done by the game author, detailed in the {fontlog} file.
The application uses the {requireJS} library for module management, which is available under {requireJSLicense}.
Some sound effects in the game were created using freely available sound samples, the sources of which can be found {soundSources}.
about.theNewBSDOrMITLicenses: the new BSD or MIT licenses
about.aboutUsedSoftwareParagraph: This game is created using freely available and/or open source software and open standards. For creating the in-game assets, {inkscape}, {blender}, {gimp}, {audacity}, {bfxr}, {lmms}, {fontforge} and specialized tools developed (in {netbeans} and {lazarus}) by the author of the game are used, and the game itself is being developed using {netbeans}, {chrome} and {firefox}, all of these running on {ubuntu}.

actionDescriptions.stopTime: Stop the time in the game, with controls still available
actionDescriptions.toggleDevInfoVisibility: Toggle the visibility of version information and framerate
actionDescriptions.toggleCruise: Toggle between cruise and combat flight modes
actionDescriptions.toggleFlightAssist: Toggle flight assist (between combat and free flight modes)
actionDescriptions.changeFlightMode: Switch to the next flight mode
actionDescriptions.nextNearestNonHostileTarget: Target the next non-hostile (friendly or neutral) spacecraft
actionDescriptions.forward: Forward thrust (free mode) or increase speed
actionDescriptions.reverse: Reverse thrust (free mode) or decrease speed
actionDescriptions.resetSpeed: Reset speed to zero (in assisted flight modes)
actionDescriptions.jumpOut: Engage jump engines and leave the battlefield
actionDescriptions.controlCamera: Hold this button to control the camera instead of your spacecraft if you have the same controls assigned
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveLeft: Move the camera to the left (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveRight: Move the camera to the right (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveUp: Move the camera upwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveDown: Move the camera downwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveForward: Move the camera forward (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveBackward: Move the camera backward (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnLeft: Turn the camera to the left (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnRight: Turn the camera to the right (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnUp: Turn the camera upwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnDown: Turn the camera downwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraRollLeft: Roll the camera to the left (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraRollRight: Roll the camera to the right (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraDecreaseFOV: Zoom in (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraIncreaseFOV: Zoom out (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.nextView: Change to the next view of the currently followed spacecraft or the scene
actionDescriptions.previousView: Change to the previous view of the currently followed spacecraft or the scene
actionDescriptions.resetView: Reset the current view to its original state
